intro: Vidoricum butyraceum, commonly known as the buttercup tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Sapotaceae. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces a fruit that is typically a smooth, spherical berry, which contains several seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
